description: Sylvester Stallone received a standing ovation as he was named Best Supporting Actor for Creed at the Golden Globes.
title: Sylvester Stallone wins 2016 Golden Globe for Best Supporting Actor for Creed
title_page: Sylvester Stallone wins 2016 Golden Globe for Best Supporting Actor for Creed | Daily Mail Online

Sylvester Stallone received a standing ovation as he was named Best Supporting Actor for Creed at the Golden Globes.
In an emotional speech, the visibly shocked actor gushed: 'I wanna thank Rocky, the best friend I ever had!'
However Stallone raised eyebrows by initially forgetting to mention black director Ryan Coogler or star Michael B. Jordan - a situation he stopped the music to rectify.
'You did it all, I just hung on for dear life,' he told Coogler - but his words were not aired as the show had gone to commercial break.
Emotional: Teary-eyed Sylvester Stallone won the Golden Globe for Best Supporting Actor for Creed
On their feet: The veteran actor received a standing ovation from the A-list crowd
Forgot them: Michael B. Jordan and Ryan Coogler are seen Saturday; Coogler said afterwards he was happy with Sly's words of thanks, even if they were not aired on television
'I am the sum total of everyone Iâ€™ve ever met,' the 69-year-old had gushed.
He then enthusiastically thanked a long list of those who helped him in his career, including his representatives and various producers.
But he saved his most touching words for his wife, Jennifer Flavin.
'Having your love is the greatest award in the world every day,' he told the 47-year-old.
Taking in the moment: Sly was definitely emotional as he addressed his peers
Proud: The legendary actor gripped tightly onto his new prize
Visibly touched: Stallone paused before getting to his feet as the room erupted upon hearing his name
Wow! Stallone's wife Jennifer covered her mouth in shock as her husband's name was read out
However the apparent omission of Cooger and Jordan didn't go unnoticed by fans, who tweeted their outrage.
Selma director Ava DuVernay responded by writing: 'Well. I'm gonna go ahead and thank RYAN COOGLER + MICHAEL B. JORDAN since no one else is. Thank you, brothers. Good work. #smh #goldenglobes.'
And Samuel L Jackson agreed, writing: '#waitwaitwait, Ryan Coogler & Michael B Jordan, Thanks for acting with me!!! Loved Sly but...'
Forgot someone? Stallone raised eyebrows by not thanking Creed director Ryan Coogler - a situation he reportedly rectified as the show went to commercial break
Big fans: Christian Bale and Brad Pitt were among those giving him a standing ovation
Protege: Michael B. Jordan looked very excited for his Creed co-star
Cheering section: Will, Jada and Trey Smith energetically clapped for the star
United: Both Quentin Tarantino and Jonah Hill expressed their admiration
Standing room only: Most of the room got on their feet to cheer for the veteran actor
Wonderful moment: Emotions definitely ran high
Reaction: Both Selma director Ava DuVernay and Samuel L Jackson were surprised by Sly's omission of Creed's director and star
Coogler himself was surprised by the reaction, saying backstage when asked if he was upset that Sylvester didn't mention him more prominently: 'No, no, no! Not at all.
'I don't know what's happening on Twitter but I love Sly.'
And he told the LA Times: 'And what he said was so nice!'
Stallone fan club: The actor celebrates with daughters Sistine, Sophia and Scarlet, and wife Jennifer
'Tumbleweed': Stallone remembered the lukewarm reaction - to his 1977 win for Rocky
It was only the second time Stallone has won a Globe, with the gong, and the gong joins his 1977 win for the original Rocky movie.
The actor has won rave reviews after reprising his role as boxer Rocky Balboa in spin-off Creed.
Earlier Sly looked proud and relaxed as he walked the red carpet with his wife and daughters Sophia, 19, Sistine, 17, and 13-year-old Scarlet.
Proud family: Stallone with wife Jennifer Flavin and their daughters, from left, Sistine, Sophia and Scarlet at the Beverly Hilton in Los Angeles on Sunday
Starring role: Michael B Jordan appeared alongside Stallone in Creed, but didn't receive a nomination
Jennifer wore a strapless grey gown with sheer, flowing skirt and train.
The dress featured dark metallic detailing on the waist, and she added a dark clutch.
The couple's daughters also looked pretty as they posed on the red carpet.
Family affair: The actor is nominated for Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture for his role in Creed
Pretty: Jennifer looked gorgeous in a strapless gown with sheer skirt and flowing train
Sophia, 19, wore a long black gown with plunging neckline and cinched in her waist with a black and gold metallic belt.
Sistine, 17, matched her famous father with a dark navy material, wearing a strapless gown and holding a dark blue clutch.
And 13-year-old Scarlet wore a white outfit featuring a see-through, strapless bodice, side cut outs and floor-length skirt.
